headline.main: NAZIS' WINTER TOLL IS PUT AT 1,193,000; Russians List 850,000 Killed, 5,000 Planes and 9,000 Tanks Bagged in Big Advance NAZIS' WINTER TOLL IS PUT AT 1,193,000

lead_paragraph: LONDON, Saturday, April 3 -- Germany suffered 1,193,525 casualties -- 850,000 dead and 343,525 captured -- in the great Red Army Winter offensive, which swept back the Germans to the west as much as 435 miles and freed 185,328 square miles of Soviet territory, Russia announced early today in a special communique.
abstract: USSR communique repts on fighting, Nov-Mar, all fronts; heavy toll of Ger materiel revealed; USSR pressure grows, Kuban area
